intro: Campanula tschuktschorum, commonly known as the Tschuktschorum bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in cold environments. Campanula tschuktschorum is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to bloom in harsh climates.
